scenario: Shares of Prologis (PLD) rose by about 5% after the company reported its fourth-quarter and year-end 2024 results, beating analyst expectations. The industrial real estate leader reported 10% year-over-year growth in core funds from operations (core FFO) and a 40.1% increase in cash rent changes on new and renewed leases. Prologis' development pipeline continues to progress, with excellent leasing activity expected in 2025. The company's CEO, Hamid Moghadam, expects an "inflection point" soon, citing falling interest rates and a strong U.S. economy as potential tailwinds. Despite being down 35% from its 2022 peak, Prologis' results suggest a potential turnaround in 2025.
